Summary: The 3 West Club is located across the street from Rockefeller Center and offers views of St. Patrick's Cathedral and Radio City Music Hall. The hotel is part of the Republican National Women's Club.
The 414 Hotel is located in the heart of the Theater District, near Times Square and Restaurant Row. It features rooms decorated with striking photographic cityscapes.

60 Thompson is a boutique hotel located in the heart of SoHo, near shops, restaurants, and subway stations. It features a rooftop bar with city views and is within walking distance of Greenwich Village, Little Italy, and Chinatown.

6 Columbus is centrally located near Columbus Circle, Central Park, and multiple subway lines, providing easy access to various parts of the city. It is close to the Time Warner Center, Whole Foods, Starbucks, and various shops and restaurants, making it convenient for exploring and experiencing the city.

70 Park Avenue is a centrally located hotel, close to Grand Central Station, that makes it easy to walk to major attractions. Many reviewers mention having a view of the Empire State Building from their rooms.

The Ace Hotel is centrally located, near the Flower District and Koreatown, with subway access to the majority of the four main boroughs. The hotel is within walking distance of Penn Station, Herald Square, Macy's, the Empire State Building and Times Square.

The Affinia 50 is in Midtown Manhattan, within walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and Central Park, as well as subway lines. Some reviewers mention the hotel being close to restaurants and bars and having a good location for exploring the city.

The Affinia Dumont is located in the Murray Hill neighborhood, near the 6 train, and within walking distance to the Empire State Building, Grand Central Station, and other attractions. The hotel has spacious rooms and offers partial views of the Chrysler Building, making it a good choice to feel connected to the city.

Affinia Gardens is located on the Upper East Side, close to museums/art galleries, Central Park, Bloomingdales and the subway, allowing for convenient access to Manhattan. The neighborhood is quieter than many areas of Manhattan and gives a residential feel, with grocery stores and a variety of restaurants nearby.

The Affinia Manhattan is in an ideal location to explore the city, close to attractions like Times Square and Macy's, and located across the street from Penn Station. It is a vibrant location with some noise.

The Affinia Shelburne is centrally located in midtown Manhattan, close to Grand Central Station, Times Square, and the Empire State Building, with modern, clean rooms and views of the city skyline. It is located in the Murray Hill neighborhood, which is described as safe, quiet, and residential, offering a balance of accessibility and tranquility.
AKA United Nations is centrally located, within a 5-minute walk from Grand Central Terminus and the UN. It's near a corner store, a supermarket, an English-style pub, and a Chinese restaurant.

The Algonquin Hotel, established in 1902, is a centrally located boutique hotel near Times Square and Broadway that embodies old New York charm, and features cozy public spaces, literary history, and a resident cat. Some rooms have New Yorker cartoon wallpaper, and notable features include comfortable beds, and accommodating staff.

The Americana Inn is centrally located near Times Square, the Empire State Building, and various subway lines, making it easy to access many parts of the city. Some rooms offer views of the street, though this also means they are subject to city noise.

Amsterdam Court Hotel is centrally located near Times Square, Broadway, and subway lines, making it easy to experience city attractions; some rooms offer street views. Reviews mention that the rooms are small with minimal natural light, and some guests have reported noise from the street.

Astor on the Park is located on Central Park West, close to the subway, allowing for easy access to mid- and downtown Manhattan, and is near Columbia University. Some reviewers mention it being frequented mainly by European guests.

The Bedford Hotel is centrally located in midtown Manhattan, near Grand Central Station, with many tourist attractions within walking distance. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State and Chrysler Buildings.

The Beekman Tower Hotel is located in Midtown Manhattan, near the UN, offering large suites with kitchens and city views from higher floors and the Top of the Tower restaurant/bar. It is a few blocks from the subway but close to bus lines.

The Belleclaire Hotel on the Upper West Side is close to Central Park, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Natural History Museum and the subway, in a residential area with restaurants and shops. Some rooms have views of Broadway and the Hudson River.

The Bentley Hotel is located on the Upper East Side, near the East River and Queensboro Bridge, with easy access to Lexington Avenue and Bloomingdale's; it is a 10-15 minute walk to the nearest subway and Lexington Ave. The top floor bar offers great views of Manhattan.

The Best Western Bowery Hanbee is located in the heart of Chinatown and Little Italy, with easy access to SoHo, the Lower East Side, and multiple subway lines. It's described as a clean, modern hotel with comfortable rooms, offering a vibrant and immersive NYC experience.

The hotel is located a 10-15 minute walk from Times Square and Penn Station, in an industrial area with a 24-hour auto shop across the street. Some reviewers found the location convenient for accessing the Javits Center and other midtown attractions.
The Best Western Hospitality House is centrally located, within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park, and other attractions, and near subway stations. Reviews mention street noise.

The Seaport Inn is located in the South Street Seaport area, near the Brooklyn Bridge, Financial District, and Lower Manhattan attractions. Some rooms offer views of the Brooklyn Bridge and the hotel is close to subway and ferry transportation.

The Blue Moon Hotel, located in the Lower East Side, is a renovated tenement building with rooms named after 1930s and 1940s celebrities, offering a historic New York experience near Little Italy and Chinatown. The hotel features art, memorabilia, and original architectural details, with staff known for providing information about the area.

The Broadway Plaza Hotel is centrally located in Manhattan, close to major attractions, subway lines, and within walking distance of Times Square and the Empire State Building. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building.

The Buckingham Hotel is centrally located near Carnegie Hall and Central Park, with subway access and spacious apartment-style rooms that allow guests to experience city living. Guests should expect to hear street noise due to the hotel's location on a busy avenue.
Candlewood Suites Times Square is close to Times Square, Port Authority, Penn Station, and subway lines. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building and the Hudson River.

The Carlton Arms is an artsy, budget-friendly hotel in midtown Manhattan, each room uniquely decorated by local artists, near subways, restaurants, and bars, providing a convenient and immersive NYC experience. Its location is ideal for experiencing New York City life, with many landmarks within walking distance.
The hotel is in midtown, convenient to subway lines, with a Starbucks and CVS nearby. Some reviewers suggest other neighborhoods like Soho or Greenwich Village might have more to do at night.
The Casablanca Hotel is in a prime location close to Times Square, offering easy access to Broadway theaters and subway lines. Despite its central location, it provides a quiet, peaceful atmosphere.

Located just off Fifth Avenue and near Central Park, Chambers Hotel offers a central location with windows that open wide to the street. Its neighborhood setting on 56th provides access to food, shopping, and entertainment.

The Chelsea Lodge is located in the Chelsea neighborhood and is close to subway stations, shops, restaurants, and other amenities.  Many reviewers mention that it feels like staying in a local apartment and allows them to experience the city as a resident rather than a tourist.

Chelsea Pines Inn is located in the Chelsea/Meatpacking district, close to subway lines, restaurants, shops, and tourist destinations. The hotel is decorated with movie posters and has a friendly cat.

The Chelsea Savoy Hotel is conveniently located near subway lines, restaurants, bars, and shops, making it easy to explore the city. It is situated in Chelsea, within walking distance of Times Square, Madison Square Garden, the Empire State Building, and 5th Avenue shopping.

City Club Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and Fifth Avenue, offering convenient access to many of Manhattan's attractions and public transportation. Some rooms offer views of the city and are close to the theater district.

The Solita SoHo is centrally located to Chinatown, Little Italy, SoHo, the East Village, and Greenwich Village, with subway access nearby. Some rooms have views of the Empire State Building, and the hotel provides a newspaper each morning.

Club Quarters Downtown is located in the Financial District, close to Wall Street and several subway lines, offering easy access to other parts of Manhattan. While the immediate area is quiet on weekends, major attractions like the Statue of Liberty, Brooklyn Bridge, and World Trade Center site are within walking distance or a short subway ride.

Club Quarters Midtown is centrally located, within walking distance of Times Square, 5th Avenue, Broadway theaters, Grand Central Station, and Rockefeller Center. The hotel provides easy access to subway stations for exploring the city.

Located across the street from Rockefeller Center, this hotel provides great access to local attractions, public transportation, and an easy walk to 5th Ave stores and Times Square area. Many rooms have a view of St. Patrick's Cathedral or Rockefeller Center.

The Comfort Inn Chelsea is centrally located near the Flatiron Building, Madison Square Park, and multiple subway lines, offering easy access to various parts of Manhattan. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building.
The Comfort Inn Manhattan is in an excellent, central location close to the Empire State Building, Macy's, Times Square, and many subway lines. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building.

The Comfort Inn Manhattan Bridge is located on the edge of Chinatown, near Little Italy, with easy access to multiple subway lines and walking distance to South Street Seaport, the Financial District, and the Brooklyn Bridge. Many rooms have a view of the Manhattan Bridge and the hotel is located near local restaurants and markets.

The Comfort Inn Midtown is located just off Times Square, close to subway lines, Restaurant Row, Broadway theaters, Rockefeller Center, and 5th Avenue shopping. Many attractions are within walking distance, and guests can find a number of reasonably priced restaurants and bars nearby.

Located in the heart of the theater district, this hotel is just steps from Times Square, restaurants, and theaters, with subway and bus stops within a block. The hotel is also close to attractions like Madame Tussaud's and Restaurant Row.
The Comfort Inn is within walking distance of Times Square, Penn Station, and the Empire State Building, and is near subway and bus stops. Some rooms on higher floors have views of the city.
The hotel is located close to Times Square, Broadway, and major transportation hubs like the Port Authority Bus Terminal and subway lines. Some rooms offer views of the New York Times building.

The Cooper Square Hotel is located in the Bowery/East Village area, close to many shops, restaurants, bars, and subway lines, offering city views from rooms with floor-to-ceiling windows. It's within walking distance of Greenwich Village, Soho, and the East River.

The Cosmopolitan Hotel is in the heart of Tribeca and conveniently located near major subway lines, providing easy access to downtown Manhattan and other parts of the city. It is within walking distance of the Brooklyn Bridge, WTC site, and SoHo.
The Courtyard Times Square South is centrally located, near Times Square and many attractions, as well as subway stations. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building.

The Courtyard Upper East Side is located in a quiet, residential area of Manhattan, specifically Yorkville, near the East River and Gracie Mansion. It's a 10-15 minute walk to the subway and close to bus lines, offering access to museums and other parts of the city.

This Courtyard Marriott is centrally located off Fifth Avenue and near attractions like the Empire State Building, Times Square, Grand Central Station, and Bryant Park. Some reviewers mention the hotel's proximity to subway lines, allowing for easy access to other parts of the city.

The Courtyard Midtown East is in an excellent location, a short walk to the subway, with views of the Lipstick Building and Chrysler Building from the upper floors. It is within walking distance to shopping, restaurants, Central Park, and Times Square, but far enough away to be quiet.

The Crosby Street Hotel is located in the heart of SoHo, steps from the subway, buses, and Broadway. The hotel's decor resembles a museum, and it features a bar with over 400 bottles and individually designed rooms with tall, warehouse-style windows.

The Crowne Plaza Times Square boasts an amazing location in the heart of Times Square, close to many main stream entertainment options, shopping centers, and subway stations. Many rooms offer impressive views of Times Square, the Hudson River, or Central Park.

The Da Vinci Hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park, and subway lines; it is right next to a McDonalds. Some rooms have street views, and the hotel is close to many restaurants and bars.

The Doubletree Guest Suites Times Square is centrally located, right in the heart of Times Square, next to a subway station, and within walking distance to many attractions and Broadway shows. Many rooms have views overlooking Times Square.

The Doubletree Chelsea is centrally located, within walking distance of Penn Station, Times Square, Madison Square Garden, and the Empire State Building. It's also near several subway lines, providing easy access to other parts of the city.

This hotel is centrally located in midtown Manhattan, near a subway, with some rooms offering views of the Chrysler building. It is within walking distance of many attractions, including Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, and 5th Avenue shopping.

Located in the heart of Manhattan, the Dream Hotel is near Times Square, Central Park, and a subway station, making it easy to get around the city. Some rooms offer views of Broadway and Times Square.

The Duane Street Hotel is located in the Tribeca area of Lower Manhattan, within walking distance of SoHo, the Financial District, and multiple subway lines, providing convenient access to various parts of the city. Some rooms offer views of the street below.

The Dylan Hotel is located in midtown Manhattan, near Grand Central Terminal and within walking distance of many tourist attractions like Times Square and the New York Public Library. Some reviewers mention street noise and views of other buildings.

Eastgate Tower is centrally located with a short walk to Grand Central Station, Times Square, and other attractions; many rooms have great city views, particularly from higher floors. The hotel is situated in the Murray Hill neighborhood, offering a safe and quiet retreat from the bustling city.
The Econo Lodge Times Square is centrally located, a few blocks from Times Square, close to subway stations, and near many restaurants, theaters, and attractions. Some reviews mention street noise.

Located in lower Manhattan near the World Trade Center, this hotel offers a quiet and peaceful stay with views of the Hudson River, but requires a 10-15 minute walk to the nearest subway for access to midtown attractions. The hotel provides spacious rooms, free breakfast, and evening receptions.

The Empire Hotel is in a great location close to Central Park, Lincoln Center, and subway stations, making it easy to get around the city. The hotel is known for its modern, trendy vibe and offers a rooftop bar with city views.

The Envoy Club is centrally located near the Empire State Building and other attractions, with easy access to subways and buses, including the M34 crosstown bus. The rooftop deck offers great views of the Manhattan skyline and East River.

The hotel is located in the Financial District, close to Wall Street, the World Trade Center site, and South Street Seaport, with subway access two blocks away. It is near the South pier, Battery Park, and Ground Zero, with easy access to transportation and nearby dining options.

The Excelsior Hotel is located on the Upper West Side, near Central Park, the Museum of Natural History, and a subway station. Reviews mention it is in a residential neighborhood, but with many local restaurants nearby on Columbus and Amsterdam Avenues.

The Fairfield Inn is conveniently located near Times Square and a major subway entrance, providing easy access to New York City attractions. Some reviewers note the hotel's location on a less desirable street but appreciate its proximity to transportation and dining options.

The Fitzpatrick Grand Central is centrally located near Grand Central Station, providing easy access to subway lines and major attractions like Times Square and Central Park. Many reviewers mention the hotel's location as being ideal for exploring the city and feeling connected to the hustle and bustle of NYC.

The Fitzpatrick Manhattan is centrally located on Lexington Avenue, close to shops like Bloomingdales, Central Park, and subway lines, making it easy to walk to many attractions. Some rooms have street views, and the hotel has an Irish bar.
Flatotel is centrally located in midtown Manhattan, within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, and subway stations. Some rooms offer city views and large windows.

The Sheraton Chelsea is centrally located with convenient access to subway lines and is within walking distance of many attractions. Some reviewers mention having great views of the Empire State Building and easy access to the surrounding neighborhoods.

The Four Points SoHo is near the 1, A, C, and E subway lines, and within walking distance of SoHo, Greenwich Village, the Meatpacking District, and Chinatown. Some rooms have views of the Empire State Building or downtown Manhattan.

The Four Points Times Square is conveniently located near Times Square and major subway lines, offering easy access to various parts of Manhattan. Some reviewers note the hotel's location is on a somewhat gritty street, close to the Port Authority bus terminal, adult shops, and the NY Probation Department.

The Four Seasons New York is located on 57th Street between Madison and Park Avenues, close to Central Park and shopping on 5th Avenue, with some rooms offering views of Central Park and the city. The hotel provides access to a house car, including a Rolls Royce Phantom, for transportation within a limited radius.

Located in the Financial District, Gild Hall is near multiple subway lines providing access to different parts of the city, and is within walking distance of the Seaport, Ground Zero, and Wall Street. The hotel's location in the Financial District is quiet on the weekends and provides a different feel from the busy midtown area.

Gramercy Park Hotel provides access to Gramercy Park, which offers a quiet enclave in Manhattan, close to public transportation and some of the city's finest restaurants. The hotel's location in the Gramercy Park area provides great access to and from plenty of restaurants and nice places for drinks.

The Grand Hyatt is located next to Grand Central station, with a walkway connecting the hotel and the station, providing easy access to subway lines, shops and restaurants. The Chrysler Building is right across the street.

The Greenwich Hotel is located in the Tribeca neighborhood, near Soho, with many restaurants and cafes nearby. Some rooms have views of Greenwich and N. Moore streets, and have windows that overlook a courtyard.

The Hampton Inn is centrally located near Penn Station, Macy's, and the Empire State Building, with a subway station close by, making it easy to explore Times Square and other midtown attractions. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building and Macy's, further enhancing the connection to the city.

The Hampton Inn Madison Square Garden is centrally located near Penn Station, Times Square, and major subway lines, making it easy to explore the city. Many reviewers mention the convenience of walking to popular attractions like the Empire State Building, Macy's, and Madison Square Garden.

The Hampton Inn Chelsea is conveniently located near subway lines and within walking distance of many attractions like Times Square, Flatiron Building, Greenwich Village and Penn Station. The hotel is situated in Chelsea, a vibrant neighborhood with many restaurants and is a good base for exploring different parts of Manhattan.

The Hampton Inn SoHo is in a prime location near SoHo, Little Italy, and Chinatown, with subway stops nearby for easy access to the rest of Manhattan. Many rooms offer great city views including the Empire State Building and the Chrysler building.

The Hampton Inn Times Square South is within walking distance of Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, the Empire State Building and Broadway theaters, and one block from a subway entrance. Some rooms have nice views, and the hotel is located in a busy area.

The Hampton Inn Seaport/Financial District is near the Brooklyn Bridge and South Street Seaport, within walking distance of many downtown attractions and subway lines, making it easy to get around the city. Some rooms offer views of the Brooklyn Bridge and seaport.

The Helmsley Middletowne is in a central Midtown location, within walking distance of many attractions like Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and Grand Central Station. Some rooms offer views of the Chrysler Building.

The hotel is located within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Plaza, Radio City Hall and Broadway shows and close to key subway entrances. There is a train station nearby and taxis available.

The Hilton Garden Inn Chelsea is centrally located, close to subway lines, Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, Macy's, and the Empire State Building, with many attractions within walking distance. Located in the Flower District, it has views of other NYC buildings and is near wholesale jewelry, clothing, and floral stores.

The Hilton Garden Inn is in Midtown Manhattan, steps from a subway station and within walking distance of Times Square, Macy's, and the Empire State Building. Some rooms have views of the Empire State Building and the neighborhood is lively.

The Hilton Garden Inn Times Square is conveniently located in Midtown Manhattan, close to the Theater District, Times Square, and multiple subway lines. Many reviewers mention the vibrant surroundings and easy access to major attractions, with some rooms offering city views.

The Hilton Garden Inn Tribeca is located between Chinatown and Tribeca, with the Canal Street subway stop right outside. It is within walking distance of the Hudson River bike trail, the financial district, the World Trade Center area, Chinatown, and the Brooklyn Bridge.

The Hilton New York is centrally located in midtown Manhattan, near many tourist attractions and subway lines, and provides opportunities to see city views from higher floors. However, the hotel is very large and busy, which results in impersonal service and long waits.

The Hilton Times Square is located in the heart of Times Square on 42nd street, providing easy access to Broadway shows, subways, and many attractions, with rooms starting on the 23rd floor or higher providing great views of the city. Many reviewers highlight the central location and convenience for exploring the city, though some mention the crowded streets.

This hotel is located in midtown Manhattan, just off 5th Avenue and within walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Station and Central Park. Subway lines are easily accessible from the hotel.

The Holiday Inn Express Times Square South is a new hotel located a few blocks from Times Square, Penn Station, and the Port Authority bus terminal. It's near subways and within walking distance of many attractions.

Holiday Inn Express Chelsea is located in a central location, making it easy to walk to major attractions like Times Square, Macy's, and the Empire State Building; the subway is also easily accessible. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building.

The Holiday Inn is located on the edge of Chinatown, with easy access to Little Italy, SoHo, and multiple subway lines, providing a convenient base for exploring downtown Manhattan. Some reviewers mention that the surrounding area offers a "real New York" experience, in contrast to the more tourist-oriented midtown areas.

The Holiday Inn Midtown is centrally located, close to Central Park, Columbus Circle, and Times Square, making it easy to walk to many attractions. The hotel has good transport links and subway access, allowing guests to easily explore various parts of Manhattan.

The Holiday Inn Manhattan is centrally located, within walking distance of the Empire State Building, Penn Station, Times Square, and subway stations. Some rooms offer great views of the Empire State Building and the Manhattan skyline.

Hotel 17 is located in the Gramercy Park neighborhood, close to Union Square and various subway lines, providing convenient access to many parts of Manhattan. The area is known for being a "real" part of NYC, surrounded by residential buildings and within walking distance of parks, cafes, restaurants, and shops frequented by NYU students.

Hotel 31 is located in midtown Manhattan, close to the Empire State Building, Grand Central Station, and subway lines. The hotel's location provides easy access to many NYC attractions and a "cinematographic and film noir style look".

Hotel 373 is centrally located on 5th Avenue, near the Empire State Building, Times Square, and major shopping destinations like Macy's, with easy access to subway lines. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building, and the surrounding area is lively and safe for walking.

Located steps from Times Square and near subway lines, Hotel 41 is a clean and modern small hotel that provides convenient access to transportation, theaters, restaurants, and shopping. It is close to the Theater District, Byrant Park, and all the subways.

Located on the Upper West Side, Hotel 99 is close to the metro station with easy subway access to Times Square. The neighborhood is described as quiet, safe, pleasant and more friendly than the more tourist-oriented areas of the city.

Located on the Upper West Side with a subway stop nearby, Hotel Beacon provides a neighborhood feel and is close to Central Park, restaurants, and markets, offering a quieter experience away from busier areas like Times Square. Some rooms include kitchenettes, providing opportunities to shop at local markets and prepare meals.

The Hotel Chandler is centrally located in Midtown Manhattan, near the Empire State Building and within walking distance of many attractions, offering easy access to the subway; some reviewers note it is near good restaurants, bars and shops. Some reviewers noted that the hotel provides a map and that the staff offers helpful directions.
Hotel Deauville is centrally located near the subway, with many attractions within walking distance, offering an "Old World" feel. Some rooms have views of the Empire State Building.

The East Houston Hotel is located in the Lower East Side, within walking distance of SoHo, Little Italy, and the East and West Village, with a subway stop nearby. It has a rooftop terrace with views of the Empire State Building and Chrysler Building.

Hotel Elysee is centrally located in midtown Manhattan, close to many attractions like Central Park, 5th Avenue shopping, and Times Square, with easy access to subway lines. Some rooms have city views and balconies.
Located in the Meatpacking District, Hotel Gansevoort has a rooftop bar with skyline views and easy access to dining, shopping, and subway lines. Some reviewers note noise from the surrounding area.

Hotel Giraffe is located in midtown on Park Avenue, is near subway lines, and within walking distance of the Empire State building. Many rooms have balconies overlooking the city with good views of street activity.

The Grand Union Hotel is centrally located near the Empire State Building, Macy's, and multiple subway lines, making it easy to explore various parts of Manhattan, and many attractions are within walking distance. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building.
Hotel Indigo is in close proximity to Times Square, Herald Square, the Meatpacking District, and three subway lines. It's also located in the Flower District area of Chelsea.

Hotel Mela is located right off Times Square, a block away from Broadway, and within walking distance of the theaters; some rooms have views of the Belasco Theater. It is also close to subway lines and bus stops.

The Hotel Metro is centrally located in Midtown, near the Empire State Building, Macy's, and Times Square, with easy access to subway stations. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building, and the rooftop terrace provides close-up views.

Hotel Newton is located on the Upper West Side near the 96th street subway station, with express trains to Times Square in 10 minutes, and within walking distance of Central Park, shops, bars and restaurants. Many reviewers appreciated the neighborhood feel and access to transit.

The Hotel on Rivington, located in the Lower East Side, offers rooms with floor-to-ceiling windows that provide great views of the city. Its location provides access to a lively and edgy neighborhood, close to many bars and restaurants, and within walking distance to other areas like Soho, Little Italy, and Chinatown.

The Hotel Reserve is located in Manhattan's Financial District, near Wall Street, the New York Stock Exchange, and the World Trade Center site, with several subway stations within walking distance. Some reviewers note the surrounding area becomes quiet on weekends.

The St. James Hotel is in a prime location, only a block from Times Square with easy access to many attractions, the subway, and broadway shows; it is also next to delis and pubs. Rooms can be noisy, but clean, comfortable, and undergoing renovations.

The Hotel Stanford is centrally located in Koreatown, near the Empire State Building, Macy's, and Penn Station, with a subway stop close by. Some rooms have views of the Empire State Building and the surrounding cityscape.

Hotel Wales is located on the Upper East Side near Central Park and the Museum Mile, with easy access to downtown via subway and buses. Some rooms have views of Central Park, and the rooftop terrace offers views of the city.
The Hudson Hotel is in a superb location, close to Central Park and the subway. Its bars and lobby have a trendy, urban feel with a lively atmosphere.

The Ink48 is located on 11th Avenue, a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square, with city views, and is near the Javits Convention Center. The hotel is near restaurants and has easy access to cabs for getting around the city.

Inn New York City is located in a quiet, safe residential area on the Upper West Side, one block from the subway and a short walk to Central Park and Lincoln Center. The Inn has no street-front sign, which gives guests the pleasant illusion of being residents rather than tourists.

The Barclay InterContinental is in an excellent midtown location, near Grand Central Station, with easy access to 5th Avenue, Times Square, and other Manhattan attractions. Many reviewers mentioned the convenience of the location and easy access to public transportation.

Located on Central Park South, the Essex House is directly across from Central Park and close to Columbus Circle, 5th Avenue, and the subway. Some rooms offer views of Central Park and the city, and the hotel is within walking distance of many attractions, including the theater district, Carnegie Hall, Lincoln Center, and the Museum of Modern Art.

The Kitano is centrally located near Grand Central Station, Times Square, and other attractions, with some rooms offering views of the Empire State Building or Park Avenue. It has a jazz lounge, Japanese restaurant, and is within walking distance of many restaurants and bars.

La Quinta Manhattan is located in Koreatown, near the Empire State Building, Times Square, and Penn Station, with easy access to subways. There is a rooftop bar with Empire State Building views and many surrounding restaurants.

Lafayette House is a boutique hotel in the East Village, located in an old building from 1848 with rooms decorated with antiques. It is near Washington Square Park, the Children's Museum of Art, and several restaurants and bars, offering a more local NYC experience.

Le Parker Meridien is centrally located near Central Park, Carnegie Hall, and various subway lines, making it easy to access many sites. Some rooms offer city views, and the rooftop has a pool and sundeck with views of Central Park.

The Library Hotel is centrally located in midtown Manhattan near Grand Central Station and the New York Public Library, offering easy access to transportation and major attractions. The hotel's rooftop bar and reading room on the 2nd floor provide city views.

The Regency is in a great location on Park Avenue near shopping, Central Park, and subway lines, but some reviews mention it's on the quieter side and not in the heart of the tourist hubbub. The hotel attracts movers and shakers with its "Power Breakfast."
The Lowell is located in the heart of New York's Upper East Side, near Central Park and Madison Avenue's designer stores. Some rooms offer terraces with views overlooking the city.

Located in the Time Warner Center with access to shops and restaurants, this hotel offers spectacular views of Central Park and the Hudson River. It is near Columbus Circle, Lincoln Center, and subway lines providing access to midtown and other areas.

The Milford Plaza is located in the heart of the Theater District, near Times Square, and offers easy access to Broadway shows, restaurants, and transportation. Many reviewers highlight the hotel's central location as its best asset, making it convenient for exploring the city.
The Millenium Hilton is located in downtown Manhattan, near the WTC site and major subway lines. Guests have reported views of Ground Zero and the Brooklyn Bridge.

The Millennium Broadway is located a half block from Times Square, and many rooms have great views of the area. It is within walking distance to many attractions including shopping on Fifth Avenue and Broadway shows.

The Millennium UN Plaza Hotel is located in midtown on the east side, near Grand Central Station and the UN, and has great views of the city, the East River, the Chrysler Building, and the Empire State Building. Some reviewers mention that the hotel is a bit of a walk to shops and sights, but it is close to subway lines and bus stops.
The Moderne Hotel is located near Times Square, Broadway, and Central Park. Some rooms have views of brick walls or fire escapes, while others overlook the street.

Morgans Hotel is located in Midtown Manhattan, close to the Empire State Building, Grand Central Station, and Times Square. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building, and the hotel is within walking distance to many attractions and subway lines.

Murray Hill East Suites is centrally located, within walking distance of Grand Central Station, Times Square, and other attractions; the subway is easily accessible. The neighborhood is residential and quieter than other parts of Manhattan, with grocery stores, restaurants, and bars nearby.

The Murray Hill Inn is centrally located, with many major sites within walking distance, and is close to subway stations. It is on a quiet street near residential brownstones, but near many restaurants and cafes.

This hotel is located in the Financial District of Manhattan, close to a number of subway stations, and is within walking distance of the World Trade Center, Wall Street, and Battery Park. Some reviewers mentioned that the area is quiet on the weekends and is not in the center of the action, but it is an easy subway ride to midtown.

The Marriott East Side is centrally located near major attractions like the Chrysler Building, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, and Times Square, with subway access. Some rooms offer city views, but street noise can be an issue.
The Marriott Marquis is located in Times Square, near Broadway shows, restaurants, and shops. The hotel offers city views from upper floors and easy access to subway lines.

The New York Palace is centrally located, near many attractions, with views of St. Patrick's Cathedral and the Rockefeller Center, and is close to shopping on 5th Avenue. It also has friendly, helpful staff.

The Night Hotel is located just steps from Times Square, offering easy access to Broadway shows, shopping, and major attractions, with subway stations nearby. Many reviewers highlight its central location for exploring midtown Manhattan.

The Novotel Times Square boasts a prime location on Broadway near Times Square, offering great views from higher floors and easy access to Broadway theaters, Central Park, and subway lines. The hotel's lobby, bar, and restaurant also provide outstanding views of Times Square.
Off Soho Suites is located near several subway stops and within walking distance of Chinatown, Little Italy, Bleecker Street, and Soho. The hotel is surrounded by restaurant supply warehouses.

Located in midtown Manhattan near major shops and transportation, the Omni Berkshire Place provides a central base for exploring NYC. Many reviewers cite its location near 5th Avenue, Central Park, and Times Square as a highlight.

On the Ave is located on the Upper West Side, close to Central Park, museums, restaurants, and subway stations, making it easy to travel around Manhattan; the Upper West Side provides a neighborhood feel away from the touristy areas of the city. Some rooms offer city or Hudson River views, and the hotel has a rooftop terrace available to all guests.

Park 79 is located on the Upper West Side near Central Park, museums, and subway lines, offering a quiet neighborhood with convenient access to the city. Some rooms are small and basic, while others have been renovated, and the hotel provides free coffee and internet.

The Park Central Hotel is in a central location near Central Park, Times Square, and Carnegie Hall, with a subway stop nearby. Some rooms offer views of Times Square, and the hotel has a gym and is located in a busy part of Manhattan near shops and restaurants.

The Park South Hotel is conveniently located near the subway, allowing for easy access to various parts of Manhattan, and is within walking distance of attractions like the Empire State Building and Union Square. Some reviewers mention the hotel's location in Murray Hill as being a good base for exploring the city.

The Peninsula New York is located on 5th Avenue, close to Central Park, shopping, and major sights like Times Square and St. Patrick's Cathedral, with some rooms offering views of 5th Avenue and the MOMA sculpture garden. The hotel features a rooftop bar with city views and is within walking distance of many NYC attractions, offering a convenient base for exploring the city.

The Phillips Club is located near Lincoln Center and Columbus Circle, with convenient access to the 1 and 9 train and Broadway bus lines. It is located near Balducci's and other stores, and some rooms offer views.

The Plaza Athenee is located on the Upper East Side, near Central Park, Madison Avenue and Lexington Avenue. Some reviewers mentioned the hotel's proximity to shopping and museums, as well as easy access to other parts of Manhattan.

The Radisson Martinique is centrally located, within walking distance of the Empire State Building, Macy's, and Times Square, and has a subway station right outside. Many reviewers mention the hotel's central location as ideal for shopping and sightseeing.

The Ramada Eastside is in a great location that is within walking distance of the Empire State Building, Grand Central Station, and other attractions, with a subway stop only a few blocks away. The area has bus and subway access, restaurants, and a residential neighborhood, offering a safe experience for those wanting to feel connected to the city.

The Red Roof Inn Manhattan is centrally located near the Empire State Building, Macy's, and Penn Station, making it easy to explore Manhattan, and is close to subway lines. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building.

Hotel 57 is in a great midtown location on 57th and Lexington, close to shopping, Central Park, and subway lines. The hotel is located in the heart of New York, and puts you right in the hustle and bustle of the city.

The Renaissance New York Times Square is centrally located in Times Square near subway stations, theaters, and major attractions with views of Broadway and the surrounding area. Some reviewers note that windows are soundproofed.

The Residence Inn Times Square is centrally located near Times Square, Bryant Park, and major attractions, making it easy to walk to key destinations and connect with midtown Manhattan. Some rooms offer spectacular views of the Empire State Building and the city.

The Ritz-Carlton Battery Park is located at the southern tip of Manhattan near the Financial District, Wall Street, the Statue of Liberty, and Ellis Island. While some found the location peaceful and removed from the hustle of midtown, others noted it requires a subway or cab ride to reach many NYC attractions.

The Rockefeller Center Hotel is centrally located near Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, 5th Avenue, Broadway, and Central Park, with a subway station nearby. Rooms have a modern design, flat-screen TVs, and free Wi-Fi, and the hotel offers a terrace with city views.

The Roger Smith Hotel is centrally located in midtown Manhattan, close to Grand Central Station, subways, and major attractions like Times Square and the Chrysler Building. Many reviewers mention the hotel's unique, non-standardized rooms, each decorated differently with a homey feel, art, and books.

The Roger Williams Hotel is centrally located near the Empire State Building and within walking distance of other tourist spots, with subway access nearby. Reviewers note the hotel's location in the Murray Hill neighborhood as being close to shopping corridors and shopping (Macys!) and offering a local feel while still being close to Midtown and Downtown attractions.

Room Mate Grace is centrally located in Times Square, near many attractions, with many subway stations nearby making it easy to see other parts of the city. Some rooms offer great views of the city and Times Square.

The Royalton Hotel is centrally located in Midtown Manhattan, within walking distance of Times Square, 5th Avenue, and Broadway, providing easy access to many attractions. The hotel's lobby and bar area are popular with native New Yorkers, giving the hotel an authentic vibe.

The Salisbury Hotel is located on 57th street between 6th and 7th Avenue, near Carnegie Hall and Central Park, with subway access, and is within walking distance to Times Square and Rockefeller Center. The hotel offers views of the street and NYC, with nearby access to tourist attractions, shopping, and restaurants.

The San Carlos Hotel is located in Midtown Manhattan, close to main sights, subways, and restaurants and within walking distance of many attractions such as Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, and the Empire State Building. Some rooms include kitchenettes with microwaves and refrigerators.

Seafarers International House is located right next to Union Square, near many shops, bars, restaurants, and a major subway station that provides easy access to the rest of New York City. The hotel is also within walking distance of a Whole Foods Market, the Strand bookstore, and the Union Square markets.

The Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers is centrally located near Times Square, Central Park, and multiple subway lines, offering easy access to various parts of the city. Many rooms offer great views of Times Square and Central Park.

The Skyline Hotel is in a good location, a short walk to Times Square, Central Park, and many shops, bars, and restaurants in the Hell's Kitchen neighborhood. It is within walking distance of many attractions and close to subway stations and bus lines.

The Smyth Tribeca is located in downtown Manhattan, steps from the Chambers St. subway station with access to several lines that will take you to various parts of the city, and within walking distance of the West Village, Meatpacking District, and SoHo. The hotel is in Tribeca, which reviewers describe as a hip, lively area with shops, restaurants, and bars that is not too touristy.

The Sofitel New York is centrally located in midtown Manhattan, a short walk from Times Square, 5th Avenue, Grand Central Station, and Bryant Park. Some rooms offer views of the Chrysler or Empire State buildings.

The Soho Grand is located in the heart of SoHo, close to subway lines, shops, restaurants, and nightlife, making it a convenient location for exploring downtown Manhattan. Some rooms offer city views, including the Empire State Building.

Soho House New York is located in the Meatpacking District, surrounded by bars, restaurants, clubs, and trendy shops. The hotel has a rooftop pool, bar and restaurant with views of the city, and is within walking distance of Greenwich Village and the West Village.
The Stay Hotel is in the heart of Times Square and close to many attractions. Some rooms have views of brick walls.

The Alex Hotel in Midtown Manhattan is conveniently located near Grand Central Station and within walking distance of attractions like Times Square and the Chrysler Building, offering nice views of the city. It is also close to amenities like the Amish Market, diners, and Irish pubs.

The Belvedere Hotel is in an excellent location, just a few blocks from Times Square, Broadway, and many major attractions, making it easy to walk to popular destinations. It is situated on a relatively quiet side street, away from the hustle and bustle, yet close to restaurants and subway lines.

The Benjamin, located in Midtown East, offers a convenient location near the subway and within walking distance of attractions like Fifth Avenue, Times Square, and Central Park. Some rooms offer city views and balconies overlooking Lexington Avenue.
The Blakely Hotel is centrally located in midtown Manhattan, within walking distance of many attractions, with subway stations nearby. Some rooms offer views of the street and nearby landmarks.

The Bowery Hotel is located in downtown NYC near SoHo, the East Village, and the Lower East Side. It has floor-to-ceiling windows offering city views and is within walking distance of shops, bars, and restaurants, offering an authentic New York experience.

The Bryant Park Hotel is centrally located in midtown Manhattan, close to Times Square, Grand Central Terminal, and Bryant Park; some rooms offer views of Bryant Park and the city. The hotel is near subway lines, making it easy to get around the city.

The Carlton on Madison is centrally located with easy access to the subway, Empire State Building, and other attractions, making it convenient for sightseeing and transport. Some reviewers describe the location as being in the middle of Manhattan but slightly removed from the busiest areas, offering a balance of accessibility and a quieter atmosphere.

The Carlyle is described as a New York institution with a classy atmosphere, offering a retro New York experience with personalized service. It's known for its old-school New York history, with Judy Collins and Woody Allen's Jazz band playing at the bar, and is located in a brilliant location with gorgeous views over the park.

The Franklin Hotel is located on the upper east side, near the 4,5,6 subway lines, with easy access to the park, restaurants, and shopping. It has a European feel and is within walking distance of the Guggenheim and Metropolitan Museum of Art.

The French Quarters Guest Apartments is located in the heart of the Theater District on Restaurant Row, offering a convenient location near Times Square and easy access to subway lines. The hotel is connected to Bourbon Street bar and is near many local bars and restaurants.

The Gem Hotel Chelsea is in a great central location in Chelsea with lots of restaurants and is a short walk away from the Highline; it is also located one block from the subway, making other areas of Manhattan easily accessible. The hotel incorporates local art and has staff that can help steer you to local attractions and restaurants.

The hotel is within walking distance of the Empire State Building, Times Square, and Penn Station. It's near the Lincoln Tunnel entrance, close to subway lines, and surrounded by various shops and restaurants.

The Gem Hotel is located on the corner of SoHo, Little Italy, and the Lower East Side, near subway lines and within walking distance of many downtown neighborhoods. The hotel is close to attractions like Katz's Deli and local eateries, with rooms offering views of the park and city streets.
The Grant Hotel is located on the Upper West Side, close to the subway, restaurants, and Central Park. Some rooms have views of brick walls.

The Hampton Inn Times Square North is centrally located on 8th Avenue, within walking distance of Times Square, Broadway theaters, Central Park, and multiple subway lines. Rooms facing 8th Avenue offer views of the city streets.

The Helmsley Carlton House is located on the upper east side of Manhattan, one block from Central Park and close to shopping and restaurants on Madison Avenue. Some rooms have kitchenettes, sitting areas, and balconies overlooking Central Park.

The Helmsley Park Lane is in an excellent location on Central Park South, opposite Central Park and near 5th Avenue, with easy access to subway stations. Many reviewers mention a great view of Central Park and the city from higher floors.

The Herald Square Hotel is in Midtown, close to the Empire State Building, Times Square, Macy's, and Penn Station, and has multiple subway stations nearby for access to the rest of NYC. Many reviewers cite the hotel's central location, proximity to public transport and local attractions as a major positive.

Hotel 91 is located in the heart of Manhattan's Chinatown, a short walk to Little Italy, with convenient access to the subway. Some reviewers note that the hotel's location provides an authentic cultural experience.

The Hotel at Times Square is centrally located near Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and 5th Avenue, providing easy access to many attractions and subway lines. Guests can enjoy the city atmosphere with many restaurants, bars and sites within walking distance.
The Inn at Irving Place is located in the Gramercy area of New York City, offering access to Gramercy Park. Some reviewers noted street noise and noise from the downstairs bar.

The Iroquois Hotel is located in midtown Manhattan, close to Times Square, 5th Avenue, and Grand Central Station, offering easy access to many attractions. The hotel is described as having a classy, boutique style with cozy and inviting common areas.

The Jane is located in the West Village, close to restaurants, shops, and subway stations, offering a location in the Meatpacking District/Greenwich/East Village. It is in a historic building that once housed Titanic survivors, with a vintage lobby and manually operated elevator, with some rooms offering views of the Hudson River.
The Kimberly Hotel is in midtown Manhattan, close to many attractions and subway lines. Some rooms have balconies with city views.

The Lombardy is a boutique hotel centrally located on 56th St between Park and Lex, near restaurants, shops and the subway; rooms are individually owned studios or one-bedroom apartments with kitchens. Its location allows walking distance access to Grand Central, Central Park, and the theater district.

The London NYC is centrally located in midtown Manhattan near Central Park, Times Square, and many subway lines; the surrounding area provides many delis and cafes for dining. Many rooms offer views of Central Park and the city.

The Lucerne is located on the Upper West Side, close to Central Park, museums, restaurants, and shops, with the subway only a block away. Some reviewers describe it as offering a neighborhood feel, away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square.
The Manhattan Club is centrally located, near Central Park, Times Square, Broadway, and subway entrances. Its location allows guests to experience the energy of New York City.

The Mansfield Hotel is located in midtown Manhattan, close to Times Square, Grand Central Station, and 5th Avenue, making it convenient for walking to many attractions and subway lines. Some reviewers describe it as having a European feel and a central location that makes guests feel connected to New York City.

The Marcel at Gramercy is located in a neighborhood that gives a real New York feel and is close to many restaurants, bars and transportation options, making it easy to get around the city. Some rooms have views of the Empire State Building and city streets.

The Maritime Hotel is located in the Chelsea/Meatpacking District, near many restaurants, shops, and nightlife options, with easy access to Greenwich Village and subway stations. The hotel features a nautical theme with porthole windows and offers amenities such as free wifi and bike rentals.

The Mark is located on the Upper East Side, close to museums, art galleries, Central Park, and upscale shopping, and is within walking distance of the main shopping districts. Some reviewers mention celebrity sightings.

The Marmara Manhattan is located on the Upper East Side, in a residential area close to grocery stores, restaurants, and public transportation, offering apartment-style suites with full kitchens. Guests have noted that the location provides a feel of living in New York, away from the tourist crowds, with easy access to Central Park and museums.

The Mave Hotel is centrally located in midtown Manhattan, within walking distance of subway stops, Madison Square Park, and Union Square. Some reviewers noted that street noise is audible in the rooms.
The Mercer Hotel is located in the heart of SoHo, near subway connections, shopping, restaurants, and downtown attractions. Some rooms offer views of Mercer and Spring street.

The Michelangelo Hotel is centrally located near Times Square, Broadway, and Rockefeller Center, making it convenient for accessing many New York City landmarks and subway lines. Some reviewers mention street noise, but the central location puts guests in the heart of the city.

The Milburn Hotel, located on the Upper West Side, offers spacious rooms with kitchenettes and is close to the subway, Central Park, and various shops and restaurants, providing a neighborhood feel. It's situated in a safe, residential area, away from the tourist crowds, offering a quiet and authentic New York experience.

The Muse Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and the Theater District, making it easy to walk to many attractions, subways, and restaurants. Some rooms offer views of the city and the hotel aims for a boutique-type feel for an intimate experience in the heart of New York.

The New York Helmsley is in an excellent, central location in midtown Manhattan, near Grand Central Station, the Chrysler Building, and many attractions, enabling guests to easily walk to major landmarks. Some rooms offer great city views, including the Chrysler Building and Empire State Building.

The New Yorker Hotel is centrally located near Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, Macy's, and multiple subway lines, making it easy to explore New York City. Many rooms offer city views, including the Empire State Building.

The Pierre is located across from Central Park on 5th Avenue, near shopping, with some rooms offering park views. The hotel has a classic New York style, with elevator operators and a complimentary Rolls Royce service.

The Plaza Hotel is located at the south end of Central Park on 5th Ave, near museums and shopping. Some reviewers mention its location as a great place to experience New York, as well as its architecture and public spaces.

The Pod Hotel is in Midtown East, within walking distance of Times Square, 5th Avenue, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, and Central Park, with a subway station nearby; it also has a roof terrace with city views. The area has restaurants, bars, food stores, and Greenacre Park.

The Premier is a boutique hotel within the Millennium Broadway, located half a block from Times Square on 44th street. Some rooms have views of the Chrysler Building, Paramount Clock, and Times Square.

The Ritz Carlton Central Park is located across the street from Central Park, near Times Square, and blocks from Madison Avenue, offering park view rooms. It is within walking distance of designer stores, Bloomingdale's, Barney's, Bergdorf's, and Saks, and is near subway lines.

The Roosevelt Hotel is located in midtown Manhattan, near Grand Central Station, Times Square, and 5th Avenue. Many reviewers mentioned that the location was ideal for feeling connected to the city and major attractions.

The Sherry-Netherland is located on 5th Avenue at the entrance to Central Park, close to shopping, museums, and mid-town businesses, with easy access to cabs and subways. Some rooms offer views of Central Park and the Empire State Building.

The Shoreham Hotel is located in midtown Manhattan, close to Fifth Avenue shopping, MOMA, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, and multiple subway stations. The hotel has a trendy, modern style, and some rooms offer city views from balconies.

The St. Regis is ideally located between 5th Avenue and Madison, close to Central Park and luxury shopping. Its central location in midtown Manhattan provides easy access to designer shopping and various dining options.

The Standard Hotel in the Meatpacking District of NYC has floor-to-ceiling windows with city views, including the Hudson River, Empire State Building, and Statue of Liberty. It is located above the High Line, near shops, restaurants, and nightlife.

The Surrey is located on the Upper East Side, a few minutes walk to Central Park and the subway, close to museums, restaurants and shopping, and near the Alice in Wonderland Statue. The hotel is buried in the midst of townhouses so it was also fun in the early mornings to see real New Yorkers picked up in their limo's for work.
The Sylvan Guest House is located in Harlem, near the Jumel Mansion, the oldest house in Manhattan. It is close to a subway stop for access to downtown New York.

The Time Hotel is in the heart of the Theater District, right off Times Square, and close to several subway lines allowing for easy access to the rest of Manhattan. The hotel offers modern, clean rooms, though some are small, and uniquely themed with red, yellow, or blue decor.

The Waldorf Astoria is in an excellent midtown location, convenient to many attractions, with a subway stop across the street. Many reviewers describe the hotel as a "classic" or "historic" New York landmark.

The Westin New York Times Square is located in the heart of Times Square, one block from the main attractions and close to subway lines, offering easy access to the city. Many reviewers mention great city views, sometimes including the Hudson River, Empire State Building, and Times Square itself.

Hotel Thirty Thirty is centrally located in Midtown Manhattan, within walking distance of the Empire State Building, Grand Central Station, Times Square, and various shops and restaurants. Reviews mention easy access to subway lines.

The Thompson LES is located in the Lower East Side, close to SoHo, Chinatown, and the East Village, with subway access across the street. Many rooms have floor-to-ceiling windows offering views of the LES and the Manhattan skyline.

The Travel Inn is located on 42nd street, close to Times Square, subways, the theater district, and the waterfront, making it easy to walk to many attractions. Some rooms have a view of the Empire State Building.

The Tribeca Grand is located in a convenient area within walking distance to Soho, Chinatown and Little Italy, with subway stops just a block away. The hotel has an open atrium lobby that is wonderful in the morning, afternoon and night.

The Trump International Hotel is located on Columbus Circle, directly across from Central Park, and has subway access adjacent to the hotel; many rooms offer views of Central Park and the city. The Time Warner Center is nearby, with a Whole Foods Market and a variety of shops.

The Tudor Hotel is centrally located near Grand Central Station, Times Square, and the United Nations, providing easy access to explore New York City, with the 42 and 104 buses stopping nearby. Some reviewers noted being able to walk to many attractions such as Broadway, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, the Empire State Building, and Central Park.

The Vincci Avalon, located in midtown Manhattan, is close to the Empire State Building, Macy's, and subway lines, making it easy to access uptown and downtown attractions. Some reviewers appreciated being away from the noisiness of Times Square and the hotel's central location for accessing Manhattan.

W The Court has a central location close to many destinations in midtown and within walking distance of Grand Central station. There are many restaurants within walking distance, and the location is described as close to Park Ave and very close to the subway.

The W Tuscany is located in midtown Manhattan, close to Grand Central Station and within walking distance of Times Square. The hotel offers easy access to transportation and is situated in a relatively quiet neighborhood.

The W Times Square is a trendy, centrally located hotel right in Times Square, offering easy access to theaters, shopping, dining, and public transportation. Some rooms offer great views of Times Square and the Hudson River.

The W Union Square is in a central location with easy access to the subway, Greenwich Village, Soho, and other parts of Manhattan. Some reviewers mention the proximity to Union Square park, markets, and restaurants as positive aspects of feeling connected to the city.

The Waldorf Towers is ideally located in Manhattan, within walking distance of the Broadway Theatres, Empire State Building, Times Square, and Central Park. The hotel is near Grand Central Terminal, providing easy access to the subway, and offers great views of the Chrysler building, Citicorp building, and East River.

The Wall Street Inn is located in the Financial District, close to subway stations, Battery Park, and the Staten Island Ferry, providing easy access to other parts of Manhattan and nearby attractions. It is situated on a quiet street, offering a less touristy experience with quick access to historic sites and various neighborhoods.

Located in the heart of midtown Manhattan, the Warwick Hotel is within walking distance of Central Park, Times Square, Fifth Avenue, and many other attractions. The hotel is also conveniently located near several subway lines.

The Washington Jefferson Hotel is in an excellent location, close to Times Square and Broadway, with easy access to subway stations. The hotel is within walking distance to many attractions, restaurants, and theaters and offers a map of the area upon check-in.

The Washington Square Hotel is located in Greenwich Village, near a subway station and Washington Square Park, providing easy access to the city and a connection to the neighborhood vibe. The hotel is within walking distance of various restaurants, bars, shops, and attractions like NYU, Soho, and Bleecker Street.

The Wellington Hotel places guests in a central location near Times Square and Central Park, with convenient access to subway lines, and is close to iconic landmarks like Carnegie Hall. Many reviewers recommend it as a good base for exploring the city.
The hotel is centrally located in Manhattan, near Carnegie Hall, Central Park, and multiple subway lines. Some rooms offer views of the city, and there is an outdoor terrace on the 25th floor.

The Wingate is centrally located, within walking distance of Times Square, Penn Station, Macy's, and many subway lines, making it easy to get around. Some reviewers mentioned the city noise can be heard from the rooms.

The Wolcott Hotel is centrally located near the Empire State Building, Macy's, Times Square, and Penn Station, making it easy to explore Manhattan, and offers rooms with views of the Empire State Building. The hotel has a historic ballroom and is located near plenty of shops, subways, restaurants, and attractions, although some find the surrounding area noisy.

The Woogo Central Park (also known as Woogo Tempo Hotel and YourStay Central Park) offers apartment-style accommodations near the 72nd street subway station, providing convenient access to Times Square and other NYC attractions; its Upper West Side location provides a neighborhood feel, with proximity to Central Park, Riverside Park, and local businesses. Some rooms include kitchenettes.

The Wyndham Garden Hotel - Times Square South is centrally located near Penn Station, Times Square, and major attractions, with easy access to subway lines. Some rooms offer city views and the hotel's 10th-floor terrace bar provides an elevated vantage point.
